content: http://cnews.canoe.ca/CNEWS/World/2009/06/01/9644266-ap.html “I think, you know, freedom means freedom for everyone,” Cheney said in a speech at the National Press Club. “I think people ought to be free to enter into any kind of union they wish, any kind of arrangement they wish.” Cheney, who has a gay daughter, said marriage has always been a state issue. While I’m glad that he’s open to it to that extent, there can never be equality until DOMA is either stricken down in the courts or repealed, as it inevitably will be. Once more Mr. Cheney is doing the political two-step, just as President Obama is on this issue. Without federal recognition marriage is a sham. It is evil and vicious to think that anyone’s marriage, their love, their commitment may, or may not, be recognized from one state to another. Surely gays & lesbians deserve the same rights that the US Supreme Court voted unanimously for the petitioner in Turner v. Safley back in 1987. Since the USSC ruled in favor of the petitioner’s rights in that case, as surely as night follows day those rights must apply to all Americans. The entire country needs to be on the same sheet of music. This piecemeal state by state thing is a great start, but it’s far too little. Gay relationships must be recognized nationwide and gay couples must have the same rights & responsibilities that straight married couples have. That can not happen until gay marriages (or civil unions if you prefer, as long as we convert all marriages into civil unions) receive federal recognition. And that, my friends, is a federal matter!
reply: http://cnews.canoe.ca/CNEWS/World/2009/06/01/9644266-ap.html “I think, you know, freedom means freedom for everyone,” Cheney said in a speech at the National Press Club. “I think people ought to be free to enter into any kind of union they wish, any kind of arrangement they wish.” Cheney, who has a gay daughter, said marriage has always been a state issue. While I’m glad that he’s open to it to that extent, there can never be equality until DOMA is either stricken down in the courts or repealed, as it inevitably will be. It is evil and vicious to think that anyone’s marriage, their love, their commitment may, or may not, be recognized from one state to another. Surely gays & lesbians deserve the same rights that the US Supreme Court voted unanimously for the petitioner in Turner v. Safley back in 1987. Since the USSC ruled in favor of the petitioner’s rights in that case, as surely as night follows day those rights must apply to all Americans. The entire country needs to be on the same sheet of music. This piecemeal state by state thing is a great start, but it’s far too little. Gay relationships must be recognized nationwide and gay couples must have the same rights & responsibilities that straight married couples have. That can not happen until gay marriages (or civil unions if you prefer, as long as we convert all marriages into civil unions) receive federal recognition. And that, my friends, is a federal matter!
title: Dick Cheney says he supports gay marriage

reply: he never said he supported gay marriage.
